website_summaries.verdict: Excellent quality sound and comfort without spending as much as the most expensive Shure models.
pros: Closed-back headphones include a detachable cable, carrying bag, replacement earphone pads, and a user guide
Produces excellent sound that isn't overbearing
cons: The headband is a little heavy and can cause some discomfort over time

customer_reviews.title: Producer/Audiophile Review
customer_reviews.text: All I have to say is wow. I'm a producer, I own a pair of sennheiser hd650s, and akgs k550s and this competes right up there with them. For such a low price all I have to say is wow. The sound fidelity, neutrality, and clarity is just unstoppable from these headphones. Prepare to be super uncomfortable the first few times you use them though. But don't worry, after those first few times these headphones are comfortable and nice to use. Overall for the price range, these can't be beat, seriously. Look no further if you want the best sound fidelity for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Arctik

customer_reviews.title: 1st time buyer; Use for work Radio Station
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for work (Radio Personality) I like the look and I wasn’t 100% what to expect, but another music lover and co-worker recommended them. - Sound can be a little staticky (music type Billboard top hits) - the headphone cord twist in and out for storage; handy for storage I assume - Sound Cancellation: I can still hear people talking in the studio, but it’s muffled. - It comes with an Aux adapter. Very happy about that, but no pockets in the bag to keep it from slipping out. Pull strings tight. - Comes with extra ear cushion/pad for replacement. Very Nice! - Owned for 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with these for the past nine years. There are several issues with it though: the coiled cord is very annoying. You can get a straight cord that works better:  Also, the default leatherette ear pads get uncomfortable after wearing for awhile. The velour pads feel much better:
customer_reviews.author: Xeraphim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound forever
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully detailed and precise with jazz, classical and rock music. As a musician of 30+ years, my ears appreciate the quality of the music delivered by these cans. I use them at work almost all day and then also when mixing my own music. The bass is balanced well with the detailed highs and the mids are very warm and present. Brilliant. They are not light in weight so be prepared for that if you are not used to full sized, closed back headphones. Shure is a great audio company with a long history of solid products. Get these headphones and stop wondering if you made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lund

customer_reviews.title: Flat enough for studio use.
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking these headphones. I have the Audio Technica ATH M50x cans, and they are pretty bassy and squish my ears. Finally with the Shure SRH840 headphones my ears are comfortable, and the EQ is fairly balanced. After playing music through them overnight for a couple weeks they broke in and the high end mellowed out a bit, which is great. Overall I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: best headphones for any price
customer_reviews.text: Forget about more expensive headphones, these are the best quality around for under $1000 dollars. I have had 2, and the only reason I had to buy a second is due to a defect in the plastic headband that makes it kinda fragile. It broke after the warranty was out and I had to buy a second pair. Absolutely incredible sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Annatar

customer_reviews.title: Home studio kings!!
customer_reviews.text: I put the Alcantara 1540 pads on these and they sound flat as a pancake now and are stupid comfortable. These have no competition in the price range. Just know the stock pads really suck. Change them and be damn happy. The end.
customer_reviews.author: Glockpocket

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, last headphones you will buy
customer_reviews.text: I never go to concerts or live music events anymore.....I just put these headphones on and it sounds BETTER than live music. Great for gaming too, just add in line mic, had to get an adapter to fit with a bit of sanding on the adapter. I use" V-MODA BoomPro Microphone" with these and it works GREAT!! The adapter I used for the microphone is "Josi Minea 2.5mm Male to 3.5mm Female Audio Adapter"
customer_reviews.author: bob plapp

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months: headband snapped
customer_reviews.text: About 6 months in, and the headband snapped. Never mishandled this product and always kept inside. Saw another Amazon customer review with the same problem. Shure is expecting me to pay to send it back when they sent me poor quality merchandise. I requested a free return shipping label in the spirit of customer service and they have ignored me for 6 days now. Great sound, poor build, even worse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Incredible quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is these things are amazing. I've had mine for almost 8 years now and they still perform exactly how they should. The quality is amazing. It's a flat EQ which is perfect for mixing and producing, which is what I primarily use them for. I couldn't be happier with this pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Robert LeCheminant

customer_reviews.title: The best deal in headphones
customer_reviews.text: As a full time audio engineer for almost 30 years, I think these are the best deal in headphones. They have a balanced natural sound without a lot of hype, and they are fairly comfortable to wear for long periods. I use them for professional work a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ronan Chris Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, so-so comfort
customer_reviews.text: These sound great--better than the Sennheiser HD 380 Pros or the Beyerdynamic DT770s they're replacing. I like it that the cord is changeable. They fit completely around my ears just fine (a requirement for me), but the padding is not thick enough to keep the "speaker" portion from resting against my ears. The padding feels fine, the speakers are just too close to my ears. There are instructions on various sites online for how to modify earphones, so I'll have to look those up (thereby voiding my warranty, no doubt). I wish I could get their sound in something as light and comfortable as the Sennheiser HD 380 Pros...
customer_reviews.author: R. Haines

customer_reviews.title: Great studio monitoring headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new pair of headphones and spent weeks searching for the best headphones I could find for under $200. I mainly listen to electronic music such as IDM, EBM, and Ambient, but I do listen to other genres as well. The Shure SRH840 headphones are closed back, which I like, and are very comfortable. I can wear them for hours without any problems. Music playback is a treat as it is pretty solid throughout the range. The only drawback is the coiled cord. While I don't like it, it is an improvement over the cord used by my last pair of headphones. For anyone choosing a pair of headphones under $200 these should be on their short list.
customer_reviews.author: raasnio

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear sound
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. I'm really blown away by these headphones. And I have very high standards when it comes to listening to music. I listen almost exclusively to classical and sometimes jazz music. Most often I am listening to choral music. The very second I began listening on these headphones, I noticed a big difference from my eight-year-old Sony 7506s. The sound on these Shures is absolutely crystal clear. I hear details of recordings that I never heard on my Sonys (and I loved my Sonys). I even hear superfluous sounds from the recording sessions -- voices, traffic outside of the recording venue -- that I never once heard before. I was very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good experience with replacement process. Great sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: After over a year of use I found the small wire traveling from the left ear to the headband broken. I sent it in to Shure and they sent a replacement to me. Aside from good customer/manufacturer support I find the sound quality great and very neutral as they should be. They can be enhanced/colored nicely with a DAC of your choosing if you are listening for pleasure. Beautiful experience so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best consumer grade headphones you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work and adore the sound quality. They are perfect for anyone who needs to hear a wider range of frequencies without paying pro audio prices. (DJ’s, music/video producers, audiofiles etc). The only downside is that Shure manufacturers in Mexico thus resulting subpar quality vs when they were making their products elsewhere in the past. These will break on you eventually. I’ve had to replace mine about once every two years.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Falk

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones last month and they are great! I got the FiiO E7 AMP/DAC to go with them and combined they are awesome. Headphones directly into phone are good, but when combined with the amp are even better. A bit uncomfortable for the first couple of days, but then I got used to them. I have been using them while I commute and even though they are pretty bulky, it's not really a big deal... though come summer I will need to get a pair of IEM due to foreseeable overheating due to complete ear cover. Last note - crappy recordings become way more annoying than when listened to on iPhone headphones...
customer_reviews.author: stefan zdraljevic

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately both of these can be easily remedied by replacing ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely crystal clear vocals and mids. My only 2 complaints are the coiled cable and the pad depth. Fortunately both of these can be easily remedied by replacing them with products available on amazon. Sound quality is just astonishing. These were my first pair of true "audiophile" headphones, they work very well even without an amp/dac but sound even better with the right hardware. If you're a vocals man like myself who is tired of super boosted bass overpowering all the singing and rapping then you've come to the right headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Harris

customer_reviews.title: amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: while i found myself wishing for just a tad more bass punch, i couldnt control my senses when listening to music through these. the quality was simply incredible. however. i tend to sit for hours at a computer desk, and these headphones will absolutely kill the top of you head. they can get very uncomfortable due to their design, which places all the weight onto the top of your head. the smaller your head, the less you will feel this. its still a great product and surprisingly comfortable, i just wouldnt recommend them for using 2+ hours
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Made from Inferior material, bad design DO NOT BUT see picture
customer_reviews.text: I was initially happy with the headphones however after just few month crack developed and eventually left ear piece fell of. There are also small cracks in the right piece. DO NOT BUY!!!! I was very careful and never mishandled my precious head phones. Very disappointed! I had Sony had phones for 5 years NO PROBLEMS! Made a mistake trying to buy new pair not from Sony!
customer_reviews.author: A. Piotrowski

customer_reviews.title: Great pair as long as they last.
customer_reviews.text: Headphones sound incredibly clear and have been my favorite pair having owned the ATH M50, Sony MDR-7506, and the Sennheiser 559. Too bad they've broken in the same spot as all the rest of the headphones listed. If you do some quick googling you'll see that this issue has been around for over 10 years and they refuse to update the product line to address. Please look for other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cruz

customer_reviews.title: The perfect headphones
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy a set of grado i80s, but I really wanted something more portable. The SRH840s are amazing, they sound phenomenal, crystal clear, comfortable, collapsible and they look good. Unfortunately, now my Wife wants me to buy her a set. I'm using them with my iPad3 with out any issue. At the highest volume settings I started to notice the audio break up, so I bought an FiiO E6 amp and a line out dock, that immediately cleared up the distortion. It was the IPad headphone output causing the distortion, not the Shure headphones. Really happy with the SRH840s, good job, Ill definitely be comming back to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harper

customer_reviews.title: So glad I purchased these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a long time-fan of Shure earphones. I decided to try out these headphones based on the reviews. I needed a pair of headphones to connect to my electronic piano. I couldn't believe how amazing it sounded when I plugged the headsets in. The notes, from end to end, sounded as if they were being played in a studio. It sounded as if I were listening to the music off a CD. I love the sound of it so much so, that I find myself playing the piano more just to hear the quality of the music. I've tried them on my mp3 player and my computer and couldn't be happier. I highly recommend these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: BryJo

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones unless you want to wear them
customer_reviews.text: They sound excellent, no doubts there, but I found them uncomfortable to wear for even short amounts of times. Its pressed so hard against my head it left a red mark on my bald head. And its not like I have a huge head. The idea of wearing these for an extended amount of time for editing music seems horrible, no matter how great the sound. Also, the travel bag is laughable for such a high end pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jemuel Gardner

customer_reviews.title: "Taste" the music as it comes to you!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in May of 2015 and have not been disappointed. The present price for them is $199 but I bought them for $153, which was an excellent price for these studio monitor headphones. I play drums and having the music as it is played, without any enhancement, is the best way to hear how the group is playing a particular song or riff, allowing me to "taste" the music in it's raw, unfiltered form. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Smyrl

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Really well built. Strong contender in the budget category. These, the famous Sony's, and the ATH-M40X are all great picks.
customer_reviews.author: TYU

customer_reviews.title: Shure is clarity!
customer_reviews.text: Love the clarity of sound! I wanted corded headphones to use instead of using my wireless Bose headphones. The Shure SRH840 headphones will not disappoint. I prefer them over my Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H.

customer_reviews.title: durable and amazing
customer_reviews.text: these things have lasted longer than most things in my life. they take abuse. they take overloads. and they sound great
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great fidelity, accurate sound representation, no over-booming bass. Perfect for studio use.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Headphone Broke Off of the Headband
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were great except for one problem: After about 30 uses the left side headphone housing completely broke off from the headband. I didn't use the headphones often, so those 30 uses spanned about six months. Pretty disappointing. These headphones are not inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Lance K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound, Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality, FANTASTIC quality and balance of sound, great passive noise cancelation. Fantastic value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L. Perry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are quite simply the best thing that has ever happened to my ears. I can now hear subtle string slides and vibratos in music that I never knew was there; it's amazing! The isolation and wide sound range make them ideal for recording and mixing audio. They are a little larger than some other headphones, but the sound quality is worth it! These headphones are also easily the most comfortable things I've ever worn. I can't recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bass Heads
customer_reviews.text: These cans sound just like the ath m50x but with more and deeper bass. I wouldn't say these are flat.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for almost two years now, used them for hours on end five or six days a week, and they sound amazing. Feel great. My favorite pair of headphones to date.
customer_reviews.author: M_A

customer_reviews.title: Shure are nice cans!
customer_reviews.text: great sound, but I wish there was a shorter cable. The coiled cable is heavy and gets in the way often. I use these either with my phone or computer so I really don't need all the length. They are also comfortable for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: Doug McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: They provide good high and low end reproduction
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use in monitoring mixes at a church. They provide good high and low end reproduction. This is a heavy headphone, although comfortable enough to wear for extended periods of time. The ear pads provide decent noise cancellation from the outside, although to really hear clearly, I sometimes need to crush them to my head to really dial in on the low end sounds. All in all, I am very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Im impressed and satisfied! Thank you Shure :)
customer_reviews.text: Got this beauty today. really love my new SRH 840s! not disappointed one bit. beautiful neutral sound, nothing too hyped..this is meant for the studio. mids are perfect, bass response is decent and highs also. the built has a nice weight to it, tho i feel i have to be a bit careful when handling as to not break it or damage the wires but that's minute, wont be carrying it around for casual listening anyway but if your on a budget and looking for a decent monitoring/mixing headphone at a reasonable price, you wont go wrong with the 840s..i guarantee you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great working headphone for Professional Audio Engineers
customer_reviews.text: I am professional audio engineer and these are my go to headphone for professional 'monitoring'. They are pretty accurate 'sonically' and great for cue'ing channels in a live situation since you can flip the earphone and just listen in one ear without having to worry about twisting the headphone and pinching the cable, and without pulling me completely out of the 'live' environment. Pretty durable as well, and for $140 a real steal in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M

customer_reviews.title: but a high quality pair of headphones like these really change the way you listen to music
customer_reviews.text: I've been used to Apple earbuds for the most part when it comes to headphones. I needed a pair for recording, and the second I put them on, it was life changing. There's not a whole of products that have made me go "wow", but a high quality pair of headphones like these really change the way you listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: great headphone set.
customer_reviews.text: great detail on sound, very flat. change the pads, I use the brainwavz hybrids on this set.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sound great.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one of those pretentious guys that'll tell you all about sound-stage and that sort of thing. Here's the deal, I listen to music for hours at a time while coding. These shut out the noise of the office completely, sound great (better than my Shure E3c in-ears) and are comfortable for a long time. They are a bit heavier than my old headphones, but well worth it for the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Brooks

customer_reviews.title: These headphones have great sound and block out external audio very well
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have great sound and block out external audio very well. The only issue I am currently having is that after only a year of light/medium light use, the first cable is starting to have issues with staying connected and will sometimes cut out the audio if the cable is moved/bumped where it connects to the earpiece.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying them. I got mad when they broke because it's a small area above the right speaker that's irreparable but they have lasted a long time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones for smaller head maybe
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-balanced pairs that is capable of handling most genres. What strikes me foremost was perhaps the soundstage. It's surprisingly open for a closed-back. I also find the build quality to be excellent. What disappoints me is the comfort level. I have a big head. Once the headphones are stretched to engulf my ears, the headband presses down against the top of my head, creating tremendous discomfort and numb feelings after 20-30 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Allows me to hear the high end frequencies that evade ...
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to hear the high end frequencies that evade my main monitors. However, I can still sense what is going on in the low end so nothing is really missed. WOULD NOT use them for recreational listening, lacking the bass most will desire.
customer_reviews.author: La'Teef evans

customer_reviews.title: A lot better than my old Koss headphones
customer_reviews.text: Back in the day Koss was considered one of the best headphones and this new Shure is a step ahead. I read many reviews before finally buying the SRH840 and I believe I made the right decision. I use them most of the time with my Ipod Touch and I have no need for a headphone amplifier. The music sounds clear beyond believe and with so much detail that you have to hear it to believe it. I paid $169 here at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Estevez

customer_reviews.title: Nice uncolored sound
customer_reviews.text: Had these for 7 years. The headband just broke but replacements are available. Nice uncolored sound. Seals out other noise. Only problem....they hurt the top of my head. Nonetheless, I will repair as opposed to replace.
customer_reviews.author: exit102

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price these cannot be beat. I've had them for over two years now, and they have survived regular use as well as my daily commute, folded but without a case, in my bag. They're a durable set of no-frills studio headphones with a balanced sound, and even provide a modicum of sound isolation. Update: after over 5 years I finally managed to somehow break one of the cups off. Most other headphones I've had experienced issues way before that, usually with the cable giving out in one or two years, so I'd say these had a good run.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Kaplounenko

customer_reviews.title: Consider these headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these headphones the family has purchased. The first set was for my son to take a music course at college, which required hours of listening. While we have a pair of the well advertised noise reduction headphones, the Shure have better sound at a lower price. They are very comfortable and the noise isolation with the over-ear pads is excellent. When it came time to buy a headphones for general listening and to have a second pair of headphones for plane flights, we knew what to buy.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and decided to buy these head phones. I listen to a lot of EDM, and was looking for a better pair of headphones. These are great for studying or wearing while stationary for a long time, but not good for on-the-go listening. They are bulky to walk around in will sometimes slide around on your head. I stick to the cruddy apple headphones on my commute, but will use this when studying or flying. Besides that, I just blast music from the speakers in my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: lo_ousi

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable sound clarity simply outstanding! I would buy these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shure Thing
customer_reviews.text: I know now to listen through multiple headsets and other speakers to fine tune your mixes and such for quality. With that said these headphones are a great starting point for me. They monitor clearly and it isolates enough for me to hear small nuances to have a decent mix when there is nothing else to compare things to. And when I get a chance to listen through other output devices it does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Jameson

customer_reviews.title: This is a "Shure" thing!!
customer_reviews.text: Every thing I hoped it would be. Very accurate sound reproduction. I found the Amazon customer reviews very helpful in making my choice of earphones. The Shure is the best I have tried for accurately reproducing classical music and opera and are comfortable without any internal noises or sounds. I am a very satisfied customer. Amazon has become my go-to source for most of my purchases because I can trust them to deliver a quality product and stand behind it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Clarity is superb, tone and balance great, sound stage fair
customer_reviews.text: Sounds almost live. Surprising the detail, almost like being there. Ear pads are okay
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Studio quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, crystal clear sound, havent't experienced material issues raised by others. I trust Shure
customer_reviews.author: Serdar E.

customer_reviews.title: luv it, excellent to get your mixs right
customer_reviews.text: this is my lucky find! :) this is the essential phone for monitoring mixes and also for master/premaster.....it is a small phone, but such a delight to listen to it....i have owned HD650, LCD-2, byer 800 and i can says this is a marvelous phone sonically....it reproduces all frequency ranges and is very balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Xan

customer_reviews.title: The best head phones at this price.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get use to the Head Phones. The are neutral and don't color the music. The y are very comfortable and can be worn for extended periods. Quality produce, good investment. My only complaint is there needs to be a cable four feet long for mobile devises. The cords that comes with it are too long.
customer_reviews.author: H3Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Shure is a sure thing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my son who needed it for one of his classes in college and he told me that these professional grade earphones were top notched. It allowed him to discover certain noise in music when wearing these earphones. This is a wonderful product for a student that's considering taking a major course in music.
customer_reviews.author: kgdop1

customer_reviews.title: but these sound great. The problem
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, but these sound great. The problem? They are not meant for people with larger heads. The plastic of the headband snapped after just 2 months of normal use and storage. I will be looking into a warranty return. Why are these expensive headphones always built with such crappy plastic?
customer_reviews.author: magguu

customer_reviews.title: Nice but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Great cans , but pricey . The Shure 440 is half the price and vary comparable
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good sound at an affordable price. Slight bump in the Bass and mid treble but not overly booky or harsh. For the price 8 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Gijr2

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I also have the SRH440 and I thought giving the SRH840 a try since I got a good deal on them. I love them! The sound is amazing (a tiny bit better that the SRH440 which is already great) but compared to the SRH440 I love how much more comfortable the SRH840 are on the head and the ears. If you're going to be using them quite a lot I think it's worth the difference in price.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolaos Kasioumis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mixing headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones 5 years ago and they are still working perfectly. I had to replace the cable, I chose a straight one. But, this is has lasted longer than other headphones I have had at this price range, which have lasted a year. They are also very flat, and have good bass response! Good Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, better than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the finest audio I've ever heard through headphones. I love the detachable cord feature, too. Kinda heavy for using all day, but if accuracy and fully enclosed comfort is what you need, it is money well spent. I read all the audiophile reviewers comments here on Amazon before buying and turns out they know what they're talking about. I write music on my computer, which is what I bought these for: Studio Monitor Headphones. I need ACCURATE sound. These deliver beautifully. I can finally master my compositions hearing every subtlety and nuance. Thank you SHURE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sanvean

customer_reviews.title: simple thoughts
customer_reviews.text: Hi All.....the reason I purchased this product was not just for the dynamic range....the sturdy construction and comfort were also most important...I sometimes have my headphones on for several hours at a time so the headset must be comfortable.....also the construction must be able to withstand the rigours of use.....I did'nt want the headset to fall apart before I get some value out of them....which has happened on other occasions after purchasing headphones.......now I've worn them for about a month I feel I can recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip G. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value + Sound
customer_reviews.text: Better than any pair of headphones I have ever owned. I've had these for about 4 years and apart from replacing the cable once, they have been incredibly reliable. Great sound for the price and perfect for a home studio.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Really good headphones, but....
customer_reviews.text: Now before I start, Let me say, these are really good, and I used them for everything from gaming, music, watching movies, etc. It's been roughly 6 - 8 months since I bought these, and there has been this weird crackling / popping sound from the left speaker, whenever any amount of bass comes into play. It's probably my bad luck, Shure is a really good name, but just keep it in mind. Also, I am not a basshead, so I didn't try to overdrive them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and settled on this one for the quality and comfort (not too worried about price). It's easy on the head and ears, cuts out all the ambient noise (including the yeowling from a demanding cat). Quality of sound repro is just what I thought it should be. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Lacks durability
customer_reviews.text: The headband snapped just above the hinge. It's been less than 3 months since I ordered. I used them regularly, but a pair of 'Professional Monitoring Headphones' should hold up under 3 months of regular use. These did not.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: a little chunky but absolutely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones with the expectation that they would have great sound quality and durability, and seal out noise well. I have used these headphones on several road-trips in very noisy conditions, and not once have they let me down. They drown out noise very effectively, while offering a colorful but balanced sound that has been excellent for Rock, Punk, Jazz, and Hip Hop. They are chunky and heavy but they are very comfortable. I have had no problem wearing them for a couple hours without taking them off. These are excellent headphones and I would recommend them two anyone who doesn't mind having a little weight on their head.
customer_reviews.author: StrummerRules15

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, they could use better materials in its built
customer_reviews.text: I dont feel complete isolation and in some parts the plastic feels a little weak. Nevertheless the sound quality is great
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Penaherrera

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the way they sound
customer_reviews.text: I am using these on my lap top. I am very happy with the way they sound. They seem to be well made and comfortable to use. I expect to use these for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Doug M

customer_reviews.title: I wear these everyday and the sound is amazing. The cord is long which makes it easy ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear these everyday and the sound is amazing. The cord is long which makes it easy to maneuver and use with my guitar as well. They do start to hurt after wearing them for long periods of time, but I have had that issue with all headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best, period.
customer_reviews.text: Everything that could be said about these headphones has already been said. They are the best closed-style cans money can buy. Nothing comes close... except maybe Shure's new SRH940 model. But at more than twice the price, it hardly matters. Get them and be happy. 'Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: The clarity of sound is great. I use it a lot
customer_reviews.text: The clarity of sound is great. I use it a lot, wether I am pluging into my speaker unit to cop a last minute rehearsal for music just given and is due or to listen to my mp unit. This makes it handy by the interchangeable jack input plug 1/8-1/4. And handy bag so you don,t lose the 1/4 jack piece. Just remember to put it in the bag when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: The standard for a reason
customer_reviews.text: If you are doing any mixing you need a pair of these. They are comfortable, even on my big noggin, and provide the needed neutral response for mix perfection. You can spend a lot more and do a lot worse.
customer_reviews.author: Gary U

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound, terrible Comfort
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these is excellent. I heard details on the 840 that I'd never heard before. However, they are extremely heavy, even heavier than the listed 318 grams would suggest. Due to the weight, and maybe the fact that the hinges sit away from the temples, the headphone would swivel off my ears whenever i turned my head. Yet, at the same time, they felt tight. The pads also get hot within 30 minutes. It's a pity that such a nice-sounding headphone has such odd engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Daren K. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality. I love the fact that it is circumaural so it doesn't hurt my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil Sastry

customer_reviews.title: Just get them
customer_reviews.text: After doing research for 2 months or so I decided to get this headphones, mostly for gaming (PS3) and listening music on my computer (iMac) and boy where they worth it, I am not going to get to specifics like many of the other reviews, I'm just going to say that I'm a picky person when it comes to electronics or gadgets, and this headphones are built with quality, sound precision, and good price. Forget about all the other fancy, over rated, over priced brands like Bose, Monster by dr dre or even Senheisser and just give this cans a try, they are really good!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great for concentrating while in my collaborative office space and while on airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Koprowski

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Durable, Closed, Beautiful Headphones
customer_reviews.text: After nearly a full year of having these amazing headphones, I am amazed that the sound quality of these bad boys still holds up. All the reviews from other sites/reviewers are absolutely correct. If you want a cheap, reliable, durable set of closed headphones, look no further. Absolutely brilliant sound on all registers, little to no need for an amplifier, and a detachable cable are the highlights of these beautiful headphones - at least to me. I bought a pair and a few months later bought a pair for my friend. That's how good these are. Easily one of my best purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Sachin Salgaonkar

customer_reviews.title: WOW! These headphones blew me away.
customer_reviews.text: These are true professional quality headphones. Frequency response is exceptional, checked with a test CD. "Soundstage" (stereo separation) is really impressive. They are comfortable for an hour or more of use. I highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: W. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: I read professional reviews of this headphones before buying them. I am so glad that I did. When I initially heard them, I was not so thrilled by the sound. Now that I have been hearing them for some time, the sound quality is amazing. The sound is very true, with no extra bass, though the bass can be heavy for bass heavy tunes. In my home, I use these headphones more often than my Shure SE530 (which are themselves excellent). I would not say that the SRH840 are very comfortable. I do feel them no my ears, but the sound makes up for any discomfort. I recommend these headphones and for under $200, they are truy exceptional value.
customer_reviews.author: Navin Kirloskar

customer_reviews.title: The Best Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: My son had a choice between these and the Bose headphones. We have several Shure products and after reading the writeups on these headphones picked Shure. My son is telling all his friends how great they keep outside noise out. He loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Suanne Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: Searched and searched and searched for a new pair of headphones. Months of internet research. Tried all the recommended brands. Then happened to find these at a Sam Ash musician store. I've tried Shure's earbuds and didn't like them, so I didn't expect to like these much either. But as soon as I put them on, I was sold. Fantastic sound. Strong and crisp over the full range. Nothing too over-emphasized. Comfortable (though not as comfortable as Sennheisers). Convenient folding design with pouch. Great coiled cable with mini plug for portable use. I can't find a weakness or flaw. Makes those twice-the-price headphones that are so popular (Beats, Bose, etc.) look like a joke. HIGHLY recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gurdal

customer_reviews.title: great headphones
customer_reviews.text: i did a lot of research for headphones for my ipod. i planned to use it out and about, and man are these just awesome. they isolate sound great, they fit great, i've worn em for days at a time. the sound is so clear, but make sure you buy high quality sound. (like 300kbps+) what a great purchase. i haven't had any other high end headphones, but these are just amazing. they sound great. the only downside is that they are a tad bit heavy. the bass is not as "boom", but it is present. i don't have a problem with either.
customer_reviews.author: Jeb Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Musicians Headphones
customer_reviews.text: 10/10. No other headphones I’ve owned have shown this much potential!!! I play drums and use these for in ear monitors!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had many headphones in the past... And I would have to say the build quality of these headphones are some of the best I have found. No regrets, and the sound quality is exceptional for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: They still sound great and have held up very well
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for 7 years now. They still sound great and have held up very well. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Shure always makes great products. These are well worth the value and definitely not overpriced. They lasted me nearly a year until i accidently broke them.
customer_reviews.author: Ayo

customer_reviews.title: Unwearable but excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: These were so heavy and poorly padded that I could not wear them for more than 5 minutes. That said, the build quality is excellent. The sound is exceptional and I really wished they were more comfortable. These produce a sound that rivals most open cans I've owned or tried. They were very clear and natural. So if the comfort is not a problem, by all means go with these incredible, inexpensive HP's.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone monitors
customer_reviews.text: My son is in audio engineering and I got these for him as a present. He loves them. Great sound. Nice monitoring tool.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tenison

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound and the sound-isolating effect. They're a little bigger than I imagined but that's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I have some hearing issues so these might be a little overkill for me but they do sound great. I am still in the burn in period on these, so IDK if they will get any better but these do sound great for the money. A little heavy the first time i worn them, took 2 days and i didnt notice anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: This Shure SRH840 headphones are excellent considering its neutral sound, quality of build, and comfort, also they include an extra pair of ear pads and carrying bag. Alltogether a reasonable priced product to enjoy music wether you are a music lover or an audiophile.
customer_reviews.author: W. Villegas

customer_reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE SOUND!!!
customer_reviews.text: I play bass and sing on my church worship team and use these on stage as part of my monitor system. The sound is just rich and vibrant. I had been using the Sennheiser HD 280’s (which are great headphones) prior to this purchase. But these SHURE SRH840’s are unbelievable. You really have to experience them to hear the amazing sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: GWT1023

customer_reviews.title: Make all the music I love new to me!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and reviewed the pros and cons. I have not had a single issue not even with a bass. I have ordered an amp to boost the performance. Overall Amazing headphones, I will not be able to leave a technical review. I know good sound and these are it. Literally puts a smile on my face everytime I listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love these Cans...
customer_reviews.text: Really, really impressed with these. I use them for creating music in my studio, although I have monitors I tend to use headphones when creating and monitors to do final mixdown. These are the best headphones I've ever owned. Enough bass, but not too much color. Comfortable. I've had all types of Sony's, Sennheisers, and AKGs over the years and these are the best I've had. Love em.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: very clear sound
customer_reviews.text: casual listener here. very good product. bass is not very heavy but it it is clear as with mid and high ranges. comfortable with extended wear. max volume sufficient without amp.
customer_reviews.author: jenna behr

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 10!
customer_reviews.text: This set of headphones is a bit heavier than my previous one. It has excellent bass and highs, and is comfortable to wear for a long period of time. I would change two things about this item if I could. 1) The set likes to fall off of my head if I look down, say at the keyboard I'm playing. Not due to lack of "spring" in the headset itself, but because of its weight. 2) The cord could have a long straight part to it as the cord is too short; I had to get an extension for mine.
customer_reviews.author: Monstrosity17

product_meta.title: Shure SRH840 Professional Monitoring Headphones - Black
product_meta.description: Manufacturer: Shure, SRH840-E, Product Version: EUROPE
feature_bullets: SRH840 Professional Monitoring Headphones feature a precisely tailored frequency response that delivers rich bass, clear mid-range and extended highs
Optimized for studio recording and critical listening
Includes SRH840, threaded 1/4" gold-plated adapter, carrying bag, replacement ear pads, and user guide

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars465 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
